intro: Boissiera bromoides var. glabriflora, commonly known as the smooth-flowered boissiera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
